verbose_text: In fact, TGF-beta1 upregulated the phosphorylation of p38 MAPK in hGFs; however, ZA (Cmax) did not suppress the TGF-beta1 (5 ng/ml)-induced phosphorylation of p38 MAPK in hGFs (data not shown), suggesting that p38 MAPK activity is not related to the suppressive effects of ZA (Cmax) on TGF-beta1-induced fibrogenic activity of hGFs.
evidence: TGF-beta1 (5 ng/ml)-induced phosphorylation of p38 MAPK
